Expectation1: Ensure client satisfaction and address any concerns or complaints professionally
Situation1: An easygoing regular politely asks for a tiny adjustment to their fringe.
Expectation2: Attend weekly church services to worship and participate in community activities
Situation2: They recognize the importance of being present at weekly services regularly
Story: I glanced at the clock as I snipped the last bit of my client’s fringe. Mrs. Lee, a regular, smiled at her reflection but hesitated. “Could you just trim a little more here?” she asked, touching her bangs. I nodded, but my heart thudded. The church bells would ring in twenty minutes, and I’d promised myself I wouldn’t miss another Sunday service. My pastor had gently reminded me last week how important it was to worship together, to be present for the community. But Mrs. Lee was always so kind, and I prided myself on making sure every client left happy. I could see she wanted to ask, “Is it too much trouble?” I wanted to reassure her, to show her she mattered. Yet, the thought of slipping into the pews late, or not at all, made my chest tighten. I held my scissors, caught between the gentle expectation in her eyes and the quiet pull of my faith, unsure which promise I was about to break.
